content: In Greek mythology, who was forced to push a boulder up a hill only for it to roll back down when it nears the top, repeating this action for eternity?

In Greek mythology, Sisyphus was the one who was forced to push a boulder up a hill only for it to roll back down when it nears the top, repeating this action for eternity. This eternal punishment was inflicted upon him by the gods as retribution for his deceitful and wicked ways during his lifetime.
